case_vignette: A 34-year-old G2P1 female at 37 weeks of gestation presents to the clinic for complaints of right-hand numbness and pain for the past month. She reports that the pain is usually worse at night and that she would sometimes wake up in the middle of the night from the “pins and needles.” She denies fever, weakness, or weight changes but endorses paresthesia and pain. The patient also reports a fall on her right hand 2 weeks ago. A physical examination demonstrates mild sensory deficits at the first 3 digits of the right hand but no tenderness with palpation. Strength is intact throughout.
question: Which  findings would further support the diagnosis of this patient’s condition?
correct_ans: tingling when the right wrist is percussed

No, this is the first time I've experienced these symptoms.

No, I haven't had any swelling or redness.

No, the numbness and the "pins and needles" feeling started after the injury.

My strength is fine, but I've been having mild trouble with feeling in my first 3 fingers.
Have you had any history of nerve damage or compression?
No, I haven't had any history of nerve damage or compression.
Have you had any history of diabetes or thyroid disease?
No, I haven't had diabetes or thyroid disease.
Have you had any history of carpal tunnel syndrome?
No, I haven't had carpal tunnel syndrome before.
Have you had any history of migraines or headaches?
No, I haven't mentioned having migraines or headaches.
Have you had any history of seizures or epilepsy?
No, I haven't had seizures or epilepsy.
Have you had any history of heart disease or high blood pressure?
No, I haven't mentioned any history of heart disease or high blood pressure.
Have you had any history of smoking or alcohol abuse?
No, I haven't mentioned any smoking or alcohol abuse.
Have you had any family history of similar symptoms?
No, I haven't mentioned any family history of similar symptoms.
Final Diagnosis: Carpal Tunnel Syndrome.
